column4: does anyone know how to format a firewire external drive in Ubuntu?
What is it's device name? /dev/sda or something?
it's formatted in NTFS right now, so it has a name. FWExternal
But what is it's device name?
dunno. if the "name" isn't good enough, how do I find out?
OK, the "sudo mkfs.<type> /dev/sda10" (<type> can be vfat for fat32, ext2, ext3, reiserfs, etc.)
which is the most desirable format? and is <type> what it is set to NOW, or what I want it to be set to?
but still, which format do you recommend?
<type> is what you want it to be. ext3 is the general Linux one, vfat lets you read/write it from linux and windows, reiserfs is supposedly a little faster than ext3
thank you! vfat sounds pretty great... I have another month or two before I purchase enough hard drive space to migrate all my media to Linux format.
vfat can't be more than 128MB apparently. It can also fragment, and doesn't support files bigger than 4GB. Also it has no permission system
oh dear. ext3 it is, then. thank you for your help!
